summary: The text discusses the calculation of 430 years from biblical events, suggesting that they represent a symbolic period from the baptism of the Savior to the end of the world. Some, particularly Jews, believe this period began in the second year of Emperor Vespasian when Jerusalem was captured and the temple destroyed by the Romans. This period of 430 years in tribulation and captivity is thought to mirror the Israelites' 430 years in Egypt, as mentioned in Exodus.
